comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: She looks mighty displeased in this photo; here was one provocation, in June 1916: SAYS FAY WITNESS HAS HER JEWELS Baroness Accuses Hotel Vanderbilt Guest of Withholding $1,000 Worth of Gems Blackmail, He Retorts Gave Them to Him for Safekeeping, He Insists, but He Returned Them Later query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0D17F93A5B17738... The Baroness further accused Carl L. Wettig, an engineer and chemist, of spreading rumors that she is a German spy. Gertrude Covington of Kentucky was married to Baron André de Beckendorff in Philadelphia in 1915. www.debeckendorff.com/About__Biography_.php
